ai.summary: An easy 5.6 km hike in the UK following rural paths between Duchess Anne and Kings Seat. Suitable for beginners and families, with gentle elevation and countryside views. Typical duration around 1.5–2 hours depending on pace and stops.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-defined paths across fields and quiet lanes, with a gentle ascent toward Kings Seat. Surface varies from grass and dirt tracks to occasional stony or muddy sections, possible gates and stiles, and limited shade on exposed sections.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for typical UK weather and check forecasts. Wear sturdy footwear and bring layers plus a waterproof jacket. Stay on public paths, mind livestock near fields, and observe gates and stile etiquette. Carry water and snacks, a map or GPS, and a charged phone. In woodland or open slopes, surfaces can be slippery when wet and wind exposure may be higher at the summit.
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to autumn; generally best in dry, mild conditions, though it can be walked year-round with appropriate gear and care in winter.

seo.title: Duchess Anne to Kings Seat – Easy 5.6 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover an easy 5.6 km hike from Duchess Anne to Kings Seat in the UK. Learn about the terrain, safety tips, and gear to enjoy a pleasant countryside walk.
